New Records: New Zealand secured a five-wicket victory over Sri Lanka, ending their four-match losing streak in the World Cup.
Sri Lanka were bowled out for 171 runs, their seventh defeat in nine matches, jeopardizing their qualification for the 2025 Champions Trophy.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka were dismissed for 171 after a poor start, losing key players early in their innings.
New Zealand chase down the target of 172 in under 24 overs, with Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra contributing significantly with the bat.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka were put in to bat first and got off to the worst possible start, losing Pathum Nissanka in the second over.
The Black Caps did the damage with the ball, bowling their opponents out for just 171 before needing less than 24 overs to reach the target.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's victory means they have all but secured their place in the semi-finals with India, South Africa, and Australia.
Only Pakistan, who play England next, and Afghanistan, who take on South Africa, can deny New Zealand a place in the last four.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rachin Ravindra of New Zealand celebrates the wicket of Dushmantha Chameera of Sri Lanka during the match.
Glenn Phillips sealed the deal in style with a fizzing four to end a run of four consecutive defeats.
Others: The match was played at the Bangalore Cricket Stadium, with the Black Caps dominating both with the bat and ball.
